qoute: An ounce of emotion is equal to a ton of facts.
A world of facts lies outside and beyond the world of words.
Alcohol is necessary for a man so that he can have a good opinion of himself, undisturbed be the facts.
Any clod can have the facts; having opinions is an art.
A fanatic is a man that does what he thinks the Lord would do if He knew the facts of the case.
A heap of epithets is poor praise: the praise lies in the facts, and in the way of telling them.
A mass of Latin words falls upon the facts like soft snow, blurring the outline and covering up all the details.
As a rule we disbelieve all the facts and theories for which we have no use.
Attitudes are more important than facts.
Birth, copulation and death. That's all the facts when you come to the brass tacks.
But facts are facts and flinch not.
Comment is free but facts are sacred.
An ounce of emotion is equal to a ton of facts.
A world of facts lies outside and beyond the world of words.
Alcohol is necessary for a man so that he can have a good opinion of himself, undisturbed be the facts.
Any clod can have the facts; having opinions is an art.
A fanatic is a man that does what he thinks the Lord would do if He knew the facts of the case.
A heap of epithets is poor praise: the praise lies in the facts, and in the way of telling them.
A mass of Latin words falls upon the facts like soft snow, blurring the outline and covering up all the details.
As a rule we disbelieve all the facts and theories for which we have no use.
Attitudes are more important than facts.
Birth, copulation and death. That's all the facts when you come to the brass tacks.
But facts are facts and flinch not.
Comment is free but facts are sacred.
Comment is free, but facts are sacred.
Conclusive facts are inseparable from inconclusive except by a head that already understands and knows.
Every man has a right to be wrong in his opinions. But no man has a right to be wrong in his facts.
Face the facts of being what you are, for that is what changes what you are.
Facts and truth really don't have much to do with each other.
Facts are counterrevolutionary.
Facts are facts and will not disappear on account of your likes.
Facts are God's arguments; we should be careful never to misunderstand or pervert them.
Facts are stubborn things.
Facts are the most important thing in business. Study facts and do more than is expected of you.
Facts are to the mind what food is to the body.
Facts as facts do not always create a spirit of reality, because reality is a spirit.
Facts do not cease to exist because they are ignored.
Facts don't cease to exist because they are ignored.
Fate, then, is a name for facts not yet passed under the fire of thought; for causes which are unpenetrated.
For once you must try not to shirk the facts: mankind is kept alive by bestial acts.
From principles is derived probability, but truth or certainty is obtained only from facts.
Get the facts, or the facts will get you. And when you get em, get em right, or they will get you wrong.
Get your facts first and then you can distort them as much as you wish.
Get your facts first, and then you can distort them as much as you please.
He is indebted to his memory for his jests and to his imagination for his facts.
He knows very little of mankind who expects, by any facts or reasoning, to convince a determined party man.
History is but a confused heap of facts.
History may never have all the facts, but history always has the last word.
I believe in general in a dualism between facts and the ideas of those facts in human heads.
I don't make jokes. I just watch the government and report the facts.
I don't make jokes. I just watch the government and report the facts.
I have faith in the United States and our ability to make good decisions based on the facts.
I might show facts as plain as day: but, since your eyes are blind, you'd say,  ''Where? What?'' and turn away.
If the facts don't fit the theory, change the facts.
If you get all the facts, your judgment can be right; if you don't get all the facts, it can't be right.
In science, all facts no matter how trivial, enjoy democratic equality.
It could probably be shown by facts and figures that there is no distinctly American criminal class except Congress.
Knowledge is a process of piling up facts; wisdom lies in their simplification.
Married life requires shared mystery even when all the facts are known.
Metaphors are much more tenacious than facts.
No facts are to me sacred; none are profane; I simply experiment, an endless seeker, with no past at my back.
Nothing in education is so astonishing as the amount of ignorance it accumulates in the form of inert facts.
Now, what I want is, Facts... Facts alone are wanted in life.
Of what use is the memory of facts, if not to serve as an example of good or of evil?
Once a newspaper touches a story the facts are lost forever, even to the protagonists.
One of the most obvious facts about grownups to a child, is that they have forgotten what it is like a child.
Paganism is wholesome because it faces the facts of life.
People can refute your facts, but never your feelings.
People will generally accept facts as truth only if the facts agree with what they already believe.
Practical politics consists in ignoring facts.
She always says, my lord, that facts are like cows. If you look them in the face hard enough they generally run away.
Simple people... are very quick to see the live facts which are going on about them.
Some facts should be suppressed, or, at least, a just sense of proportion should be observed in treating them.
Sometimes legends make reality, and become more useful than the facts.
Telling a teenager the facts of life is like giving a fish a bath.
That's the kind of ad I like, facts, facts, facts.
The construction of life is at present in the power of facts far more than convictions.
The degree of one's emotions varies inversely with one's knowledge of the facts.
The facts fairly and honestly presented; truth will take care of itself.
The great virtue in life is real courage that knows how to face facts and live beyond them.
The imaginations which people have of one another are the solid facts of society.
The important thing in science is not so much to obtain new facts as to discover new ways of thinking about them.
The main part of intellectual education is not the acquisition of facts but learning how to make facts live.
The most difficult We do not deal in facts when we are contemplating ourselves.
The only human value of anything, writing included, is intense vision of the facts.
The right honorable gentlemen is indebted to his memory for his jokes and his imagination for his facts.
The safest words are always those which bring us most directly to facts.
The truth is more important than the facts.
The truth is more important than the facts.
The work of science is to substitute facts for appearances, and demonstrations for impressions.
Theories that go counter to the facts of human nature are foredoomed.
There are no eternal facts, as there are no absolute truths.
There are no facts, only interpretations.
There's a world of difference between truth and facts. Facts can obscure the truth.
This is one of those cases in which the imagination is baffled by the facts.
Time dissipates to shining ether the solid angularity of facts.
To some lawyers, all facts are created equal.
Trust your hunches. They're usually based on facts filed away just below the conscious level.
Unlike the masses, intellectuals have a taste for rationality and an interest in facts.
We must have strong minds, ready to accept facts as they are.
What are facts but compromises? A fact merely marks the point where we have agreed to let investigation cease.
What matters is not the facts but how you discover and think about them.
When you seek advice, do not withhold any facts from the person whose advice you seek.
Words had become to him a means of obscuring facts - not of revealing them.
Your desires and true beliefs have a way of playing blind man's bluff. You must corner the inner facts...
